Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Vroulian pottery kylix; interior: reserved band at rim with one group of short vertical dashes; glazed black below; top and outside of everted rim glazed; in reserved handle zone, St. Andrew's crosses alternating with groups of vertical strokes, between single lines.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Kinch (1914), p. 128, fig. 120. The Sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1914,0317.5.b, 1914,0317.5.c and 1914,0317.5.e, though they do not preserve any verticals in the reserved band on the inside of the lip.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.27) (phase 3)
